title: What Is Mennonite? | Oh My God | Parable
description:
There are over 2 million Mennonites, yet their beliefs and cultures are commonly misunderstood. Not to be confused with the Amish, Mennonites live without modern conveniences, drive horse and buggies and worship in their own devout yet simple ways. Join Tevya as he goes off the grid into a world where technology is taboo and life is humble. Can this city boy survive a cattle auction, farming by hand and a quilting circle?

description:

Written in mysterious ancient scripts from around the world, they supposedly told of a Near Eastern culture living in North America. description:

description:

title: Is Jezebel The Most Reviled Woman In The Bible? | Notorious Women Of The Bible | Parable
description:
Jezebel’s story is a rich mix of historical events, allegorical interpretation and metaphorical licence, yet her name is still synonymous with feminine evil. At the climax of her long struggle to bring pagan worship to the kingdom of Israel, Queen Jezebel paid a terrible price. To modern feminist authors, she is one of the most intriguing women in the scriptures. Though denounced as a murderer, prostitute and enemy of God, some still find reasonto admire this ancient queen.

title: Downsizing Beach House For The Future | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Patti and Ralph have lived in their family beach house ever since he built it 20 years ago. And not much has changed, including the outdated décor and some of the flaws that come with DIY territory.  With their first child already in college and the three others quickly catching up, the couple is shifting their focus and need to downsize for the future. So now it’s up to property expert Sofie Allsopp to revamp this dated beach house before it languishes on the market for yet another year.
 

From The Unsellables - Sun, Surf & Selling

British real estate agent Sofie Allsopp takes on the challenges of getting homeowners to understand what it takes to get their homes sold. Along for the ride is contractor Anthony Sayers, who completes the makeovers recommended by Allsopp.

When business grinds to a halt, Binion's doubles down on winning younger customers with fresh tactics. title: Man-cave Turning Of Major Buyers | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Nadine and Travon’s house has been on the market for 18 months without a single offer. And with clutter and clothes everywhere, it’s no wonder! In spite of its serious curb appeal, potential buyers can’t get past the messy and bland interiors to see the home’s potential. Not to mention, Travon’s dark man-cave is a major turnoff. Determined to turn things around, property expert Sofie Allsopp steps in with a gorgeous design plan and a big lesson in real estate 101.

In order to give the home personality and a much-need ‘wow’ factor, Sofie unveils a radical design makeover. And while Anthony and the team repaint, give every room a proper function, and create a custom home office and glamorous master retreat, Sofie gives the couple an emergency lesson in basic real estate.

Jerry and Sally are eager to move their three kids in time for the new school year but their unsellable home is holding them back and time is running out. title: Emergency Lesson In Basic Real Estate | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Sick to death of their insane commute, Andy and Emily are desperate to sell their three-bedroom, semi-detached home...But after three long months on the market, they’ve switched agents and still haven’t received a single offer. The near-new, semi-detached property features a great, split-level layout in a popular new lakeside community...But with its lackluster, builder’s white interiors, cluttered kitchen, drab master bedroom, and weird room allocation, the home is turning buyers off.

In order to give the home personality and a much-need ‘wow’ factor, Sofie unveils a radical design makeover. And while Anthony and the team repaint, give every room a proper function, and create a custom home office and glamorous master retreat, Sofie gives the couple an emergency lesson in basic real estate.
 

From The Unsellables "Absentee Agent"

British real estate agent Sofie Allsopp takes on the challenges of getting homeowners to understand what it takes to get their homes sold. Along for the ride is contractor Anthony Sayers, who completes the makeovers recommended by Allsopp.

title: "There's Nothing Wrong With Our House" | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Soon-to-be empty nesters, Marco and Maria, are desperate to sell their four-bedroom home so they can travel and move closer to their grown-up kids...But after six weeks on the market, 18 viewings, and no offers, they’re not going anywhere. Billed as a condo alternative just minutes from downtown, the home is in a great location. And, although the owners insist there’s nothing wrong with it, the home’s overstuffed, cluttered interiors, religious art, fake flowers, ramshackle mudroom, and astro-turfed backyard are seriously turning buyers off.

In order to compete with the area’s modern luxury condos, Sofie comes up with plans for a radical overhaul. And while Anthony and the team declutter, reveal the home’s impeccable hardwood floors, and transform the mudroom and backyard, Sofie gives Marco and Maria a lesson in how to present a house for sale.
 

From The Unsellables "Condo Competition"

British real estate agent Sofie Allsopp takes on the challenges of getting homeowners to understand what it takes to get their homes sold. Along for the ride is contractor Anthony Sayers, who completes the makeovers recommended by Allsopp.

title: Modernising Dull Garden and Old-Fashioned Kitchen | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
In order to spend more time in Mexico with their parents, sisters Esther and Libertad want to sell their four-bedroom bungalow...But after a year on the market with roller coaster pricing and multiple agents, the property is turning buyers off. On the plus side, the home features a partial renovation and basement apartment, all on the edge of an affluent neighborhood...But with its dowdy kitchen, reams of knickknacks, dull garden, and busy thoroughfare location, the home is completely unsellable.
 
In order to appeal to upscale buyers and show off the home’s best assets, Sofie comes up with a knockout design plan. And while Anthony and the team declutter the home, modernize the kitchen, and add personality to the back garden, Sofie gives the sisters a much-needed lesson in real estate 101.

title: Can You Sell A House Without An Agent? | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Gail and her daughters have outgrown their modest two-bedroom home, and while Mom thought she could sell the property without a realtor, six weeks have passed without a single offer. Hiring a professional agent is sure to improve her prospects, but with its shoddy paint job, peeling wallpaper, ratty carpet runner, and ramshackle front and back porches, Gail’s semi-detached home is completely unsellable.

In order to give the property the polish buyers expect, Sofie comes up with a dramatic design plan.  And while Anthony and the team neutralize the paint, lay new carpet, and repair the porches, Sofie shows Gail what it will take to convert her home from sad to sold.

From The Unsellables "DIY Disaster"

British real estate agent Sofie Allsopp takes on the challenges of getting homeowners to understand what it takes to get their homes sold. Along for the ride is contractor Anthony Sayers, who completes the makeovers recommended by Allsopp.

title: Is Your Home Too Eccentric For Average Home Buyer? | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Since they’ve already bought an even bigger property, Michelle and Shawn are desperate to sell their three-bedroom home. But after a month on the market, the listing hasn’t attracted a single buyer. With its gracious appointments, landscaped gardens, and award-winning waterfront community setting, the home should be a runaway success...But with its manic color scheme, hidden features, oddball knickknacks, and over-personalized interiors, the property is completely unsellable.

In order to appeal to the broadest range of buyers, Sofie steps in with a knock-out design plan. And while Anthony and the team neutralize the paint colors, repurpose the furniture, and improve curb appeal, Sofie walks the homeowners through the basics of real estate 101.

From The Unsellables "Colour Catastrophe "

title: Cash Investigation: Exposing Eco-Friendly Marketing Tactics | Business Stories
description:
Big brands have suddenly become environmentally responsible. Or have they? At any rate, they are proudly showing off their newfound commitment in their ads and packaging. Some have even invented “green labels” to grant them more credibility and sell more products. And yet, the activities of these same virtuous, eco-friendly companies calls into question their commitment to the environment. We investigate the world of green marketing and expose the bank that uses Sean Connery and the NGO, WWF, to support its claim of ecological conversion while secretly financing some of the world’s most polluting industrial projects.

title: Cool Dad Pad Needs Revamping For Sale | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Rob is desperate to pursue his lifelong ambition of writing a novel in the Florida Keys. But after a month on the market, and 27 viewings, his unsellable home is holding him back. Nestled in a popular neighborhood, the quaint, detached property is priced to sell, and has plenty of features…But with its confused kitchen, exposed wiring, and sunroom turned storage area, the curtain-free, bachelor pad interiors lack warmth, and are turning buyers off.

Hoping to send Rob packing down South, Sofie comes up with a plan to transform the home’s interiors to reflect the standard buyers expect. And, while Anthony and the team repaint, revamp the kitchen, and tackle unfinished DIY, Sofie investigates Rob’s business relationship with his ex-wife/real estate agent.

From The Unsellables "Cool Dad Pad"

British real estate agent Sofie Allsopp takes on the challenges of getting homeowners to understand what it takes to get their homes sold. Along for the ride is contractor Anthony Sayers, who completes the makeovers recommended by Allsopp.

title: Semi-detached Edwardian Home With A Dog Mausoleum | Real Estate Documentary | Business Stories
description:
Laura and Errol thought their semi-detached Edwardian home was soundproof…That is, until the new neighbors — her ex-husband’s cousins — moved in next door. Now, the couple is desperate to sell the three-bedroom house, but after six weeks on the market, they haven’t received a single offer. On the plus side, the charming home offers plenty of potential, but with its dark, drab interiors, covered windows, ratty brown furnishings, and dog mausoleum, the property is completely unsellable.

In order to match the home to its price tag, Sofie comes up with a plan to bring out its innate cottage charm. And while Anthony and the team get busy painting, updating the décor, and revealing the home’s features, Sofie intervenes with the agent/friend, and shows the couple what it takes to make a fantastic first impression.


From The Unsellables "It’s A Dog’s House"

British real estate agent Sofie Allsopp takes on the challenges of getting homeowners to understand what it takes to get their homes sold. Along for the ride is contractor Anthony Sayers, who completes the makeovers recommended by Allsopp.

title: The Untold Story Of The Black Eyed Peas | Amplified
description:
This film thoroughly explores the worldwide phenomenon that is the Black Eyed Peas. When discussing the characterisation of the group, status quo is a term that will more than likely NOT come up during the conversation. As a matter of fact, judging from their distinctive sound and style, one would probably be safe to assume that outside the box is the only place they feel comfortable. The Black Eyed Peas have been able to successfully dodge Hip Hops many pigeon-holes and firmly establish themselves inside a personalised niche amongst the materialism and violence that often saturates rap music.

title: Through Thick And Thin: The Clintons' Untold Story  (Full Documentary) | Amplified
description:
Interested in humanitarian causes, politics and the arts, the Clinton’s have been a pioneering family who have supported and driven each other in their unrivaled careers. Although they have one of the most dissected marriages in America, Bill and Hillary Clinton have kept their marriage together in spite of rough times, complicated and busy schedules, and lack of privacy. While Hillary Rodham Clinton’s activism as First Lady resulted in probably the highest public profile ever accorded a presidential spouse, the Clinton’s were deeply protective of the priva- cy of their only child, Chelsea. Chelsea, was born on February 27, 1980, and spent her entire childhood as the daughter of two very active and politically driven public figures. Driven begins with the Bill and Hillary story with their first meeting in the Yale Law School library in a fabled and maybe even true story of how Hillary accosted Bill who was so smitten he couldn’t remember his own name. We track family life, examine their political careers and explore the highs, lows and challenges that this polarizing family has endured along the way.

Content licensed from Canamedia. Any queries, please contact us at: owned-enquiries@littledotstudios.com

title: Zack Efron: The Evolution Of A Heart-Throb | Amplified
description:
Schoolʼs Out charts the meteoric rise of Zac Efron, from a school kid who had to chase girls to get them to go out with him to the heart throb he is today, adored by millions of 13 year olds around the world (and some of their mums!). Of the cast of High School Musical, the actor most likely to enjoy a career outside of Disneyʼs most famous franchise is Efron. As his foray into romantic comedy -- 17 Again -- shows, heʼs more than just a one-trick pony. But Zac and his cast-mates should never forget the vehicle that brought them so much success and adulation. From the moment it was broadcast (originally on the Disney Channel) HSM was a hit, propelling Efron, his co- star and girlfriend Vanessa Hudgens, as well as the rest of the cast (Ashley Tisdale, Monique Coleman and Corbin Bleu) into the stratosphere.

title: Glastonbury: The Movie In Flashback | Amplified
description:
Remember the wondrous feeling of attending a music festival? Relive it with Glastonbury in Flashback .

Iconic and unique, Glastonbury is the legendary forerunner of music festivals.

If you were there you're in it and if not you'll wish you had been as you are immersed in a no-holds-barred trip through music, magic and midsummer madness. Hailed as "a masterpiece" by Academy Award winner Mike Leigh, it's a must-see for all festival fans.

title: JFK Assassination: The  Tragic Day That Changed American History | Amplified
description:

title: You’ll Never Walk Alone: How a Song Forever Marked Football | Amplified
description:
The film ‘You´ll Never Walk Alone’ tells the story of a song that has become the epitome of a global folk song. Each and every weekend, hundreds of thousands of football fans sing it in stadiums all over the world. ‘You´ll Never Walk Alone’ has been interpreted by Elvis Presley, Louis Armstrong, Doris Day, Johnny Cash, The Three Tenors – and many more. But who would know that the roots of the tune go back to Budapest in the year 1909 – to a young playwright and a stage play called Liliom?

title: The Rise Of Mao Zedong | Parade Of The Waking Giant | Timeline
description:
On October 1, 1949 Mao Zedong held a victory celebration parade in Tian'amen Square and announced to the world the creation of a People's Republic of China. China had awakened, and the decades since have given truth to Napoleon's prophetic words. Interestingly, very few people actually understood Mao's speech, and only one sentence has ever been translated and synched to audio - until now. October 1949 is a definitive account of how Mao orchestrated and carried out this spectacular parade, all the while facing threats of an on-going civil war. Go behind the scenes of this parade with filmmaker Peter Du Cane as he unearths rare archive footage and pieces together the remainder of this historic speech and makes it whole for the first time ever.

description:

title: Sinking The Bismarck | History Hit LIVE on Timeline
description:
Under the cover of darkness in the early morning hours of May 19, 1941, the most formidable battleship to have ever been built slipped into the Baltic Sea on its maiden voyage. An ocean-bound castle, the thickly armoured Bismarck was the first full-scale battleship constructed by the German navy since World War I. Here, we discuss the daring, desperate raid conducted by the Allies to sink this seemingly invincible behemoth.

title: Defending The Reich: Hitler's Atlantic Sea Wall | History Hit LIVE on Timeline
description:
The Atlantic Wall is one of the biggest construction projects in history a line of formidable defences stretching from the Pyrenees to the Norwegian Arctic but how effective was it? Dan speaks to James Rogers, host of our podcast Warfare, about his recent History Hit documentary In Defence of the Reich: Hitler's Atlantic Wall. They discuss how and why the Atlantic Wall was built, Hitler's obsession with it, how effective it was and whether it could have ever been successful against an allied invasion.

title: Why Are There Ancient Coffins Hanging From China's Cliffs? | Mysterious Hanging Coffins | Timeline
description:
In the mountains of China's Sichuan Province is the sight of hundreds of ancient wooden coffins hanging precariously from a cliff face. Some experts believe the dead were placed there thousands of years ago to be within reach of the gods, while others say it was to keep them away from wild animals. This film chronicles an effort by scientists to understand and preserve these mysterious coffins.

title: How The World Narrowly Avoided Nuclear War | The Cuban Colonel | Timeline
description:
Colonel Osvaldo Fernandez was one of the few Cubans who actually knew what was going on at the time. As a young liaison officer, his job was to follow the Soviet troops to the various sites where their deadly nuclear missiles would be installed, to save Cuba from a US invasion. 45 years on Colonel Fernandez meets with Russian general Victor Yesin, who pays a last visit to Cuba, to see the place where he served as a young lieutenant in charge of putting the warheads on the missiles.

title: What Was Normal Life Like In Pompeii Before Its Destruction? | Pompeii with Mary Beard | Odyssey
description:
The destruction of Pompeii came at the hands of one of the most famous volcanic eruptions in history. We know how its victims died, but this film sets out to answer another question - how did they live? Gleaning evidence from an extraordinary find, Cambridge professor and Pompeii expert Mary Beard provides new insight into the lives of the people who lived in the shadow of Mount Vesuvius before its cataclysmic eruption.

title: How The Germanic Hero Arminius Humiliated Rome | Archaeology | Odyssey
description:
Sweeping aside nearly 2,000 years of doubt and mystery, on-going excavations in Germany's Teutoberg Forest have revealed the location of one of the bloodiest battles of antiquity. In 9 AD, an arrogant Roman general, Publius Varus, anticipated that he would easily suppress several rebellious Germanic tribes, after which he could leisurely march his troops to their winter campsite. Unfortunately for Varus and three of Rome's crack legions, he walked into an elaborate and well-organized ambush.

title: The Dark and Bloody Rituals Of The Maya | Archaeology | Odyssey
description:
Twenty-five years ago, the ancient Mayans were thought to be a mysterious and peaceful people governed by astronomer-priests. But in 1965, Russian linguist Yuri Knorosov cracked the phonetic code of Mayan hieroglyphic writing in the confinements of his bustling Leningrad study. Today, researchers reveal stories of Mayan blood sacrifices as they uncover a world so foreign as to defy our understanding of it.

title: The History Of Rome's Ancient Slums | Meet The Romans | Odyssey
description:
Professor Mary Beard descends into the city streets to discover the dirt, crime, sex and slum conditions in the world's first high-rise city. This Rome is not the marble Rome we know, but a vast, messy metropolis with little urban planning, where most Romans lived in high-rise apartment blocks with little space, light, or even sanitation.

title: The Lost Faiths Of The Ancient Celts | The Lost Gods | Odyssey
description:
The Celts believed in benign spirits and demonic forces, but made no churches or temples: nature itself was their cathedral. Kenneally visits ancient Celtic settlements in Austria, Italy and Greece. He explores the settlement of Castell Henllys in Wales, where the religion of the druids was broken by Roman military might. And at Newgrange, Ferrycarraig and Dun Aengus in Ireland, he reveals how the Celts came to adopt the Gods of those who had preceded them.

title: The Lost Civilisation Of The Minoans | Island Of The Minotaur | Odyssey
description:
Just over 100 years ago, English archaeologist Arthur Evans went to the 'Minotaur's Island' to explore the roots of this myth and discovered instead a sophisticated Bronze Age civilisation that had been lost to history for thousands of years.

He called them The Minoans, and the riches of their culture astonished the world, prompting Evans to proclaim them the first civilisation of the Western World. But was this view unduly romantic? Recent archaeological discoveries have added fascinating layers of complexity to the picture originally painted by Evans.

title: What Caused The Collapse Of Ancient Sparta? | The Spartans | Odyssey
description:
The Spartans chronicles the rise and fall of one of the most extreme civilisations the world has ever witnessed. A civilization that was founded on discipline, sacrifice and frugality where the onus was on the collective and the goal was to create the perfect state, and the perfect warrior.  Classical historian Bettany Hughes reveals the secrets and complexities of everyday Spartan life: homosexuality was compulsory, money was outlawed, equality was enforced, weak boys were put to death and women enjoyed a level of social and sexual freedom that was unheard of in the ancient world.

title: How The Spartan-Athenian Alliance Became Hostile | The Spartans | Odyssey
description:
Athens, which had been allied with Sparta against Persia, begins to experience an expanded economy (and democracy under the leadership of Pericles).
